text.136_Daf, 19_Line: 7. [A mishnah on a different subject which deals with a similar issue]
text.136_Daf, 5_Line: 5. AND THOUGH THERE IS NO ABSOLUTE PROOF, THERE IS A SUGGESTION FOR THIS, AS IT IS WRITTEN, BE NOT AMONG THOSE WHO GUZZLE WINE [BE-SOBE]; AMONG GLUTTONOUS EATERS OF FLESH [BE-ZOLELE]. (Proverbs 23:20)
text.136_Daf, 26_Line: R. Hanina b. Kahana said: As long as the flesh of the peace offering may be eaten.
text.136_Daf, 32_Line: and it has been taught: wine in the first stage of fermentation does not come within the prohibition against uncovered liquid: and how long is this first stage?  Three days.
text.136_Daf, 34_Line: Now, what is the law here?
text.136_Daf, 8_Line: R. Zera said: I do not know what is this tartemar; but since R. Jose doubled the measure of wine, he must have doubled that of meat too; hence the tartemar is half a mina.
text.136_Daf, 14_Line: But that is not so, for did not Rabbah and R. Joseph both say: If he ate raw meat or drank undiluted wine, he does not become a ‘stubborn and rebellious son’?
text.136_Daf, 30_Line: As long as it is in its first stage of fermentation;
text.136_Daf, 10_Line: R. Hanan b. Moladah said in R. Huna’s name: He is not liable unless he buys meat and wine cheaply and consumes them, for it is written. “He is a Zolel”.
text.136_Daf, 31_Line: 13. [Parenthetical baraita regarding the nature of new wine]
text.136_Daf, 3_Line: 3. IF HE ATE IT IN A COMPANY [CELEBRATING] A RELIGIOUS ACT, OR GATHERED FOR THE PURPOSE OF INTERCALATING THE MONTH; IF HE ATE THE SECOND TITHE IN JERUSALEM; IF HE ATE THE NEBELOTH OR TEREFOTH, ABOMINABLE AND CREEPING THINGS, OR TEBEL, OR THE FIRST TITHE FROM WHICH TERUMAH HAD NOT BEEN SEPARATED, OR UNREDEEMED SECOND TITHE, OR UNREDEEMED SACRED FOOD; IF HIS EATING INVOLVED A RELIGIOUS ACT OR A TRANSGRESSION; IF HE ATE ANY FOOD BUT MEAT OR DRANK ANY DRINK BUT WINE, HE DOES NOT BECOME A ‘STUBBORN AND REBELLIOUS SON THEREBY, UNLESS HE EATS MEAT AND DRINKS WINE,
text.136_Daf, 12_Line: R. Hanan b. Moladah also said in R. Huna’s name: He is not liable unless he eats raw meat and drinks undiluted wine.
text.136_Daf, 2_Line: 2. R. JOSE SAID: A MINA OF FLESH AND A LOG OF WINE.
text.136_Daf, 36_Line: There [the prohibition of eating meat on the eve on the month of Ab] is on account of joy: as long as it is as the flesh of a peace offering, it yields the joy of meat eating. Here, however, it is on account of its seductiveness, and when a short period has passed, it no longer attracts, whilst wine is unattractive until it is forty days old.
text.136_Daf, 16_Line: Rabina answered, by ‘undiluted wine’ insufficiently diluted wine is meant, and raw meat means only partially cooked, like charred meat eaten by thieves.
text.136_Daf, 28_Line: And how long is it called new wine?
text.136_Daf, 4_Line: 4. FOR IT IS WRITTEN, [THIS OUR SON IS STUBBORN AND REBELLIOUS HE WILL NOT OBEY OUR VOICE;] HE IS A GLUTTON [ZOLEL] AND A DRUNKARD [WE-SOBE]. (Deut. 21:20),
text.136_Daf, 1_Line: 1. WHEN DOES HE BCOME LIABLE?  WHEN HE EATS A TARTEMAR OF MEAT AND DRINKS HALF A LOG OF ITALIAN WINE.
text.136_Daf, 23_Line: 9. [Shealah clarification of the subject of the baraita]
text.136_Daf, 18_Line: Rabbah and R. Joseph both said: If he eats pickled meat or drinks ‘wine from the vat’, [i. e., new wine before it has matured], he does not become a stubborn and rebellious son’.
text.136_Daf, 20_Line: We learnt elsewhere [in the Mishnah]: On the eve of the ninth of Ab one must not partake of two courses, neither eat meat nor drink wine.
text.136_Daf, 24_Line: Now, what length of time must elapse before it is regarded as pickled meat [as opposed to fresh meat]?
text.136_Daf, 22_Line: And a Tanna taught: But he may eat pickled meat and drink new wine.
